result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clint L. Block

records.addlTxt: PD has not found an attorney update
Sent Notice of Hearing to his address we have on file and also to the Farhman Center in Eau Claire

4:09 PM Defendant Clint L. Block appeared by phone from Fahrman Center .  Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Still did not find an attorney
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
No attorney has been found

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Eligible, but no one found yet

11:09 AM Defendant Clint L. Block appeared by video from Clark County Jail  Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Original Bond returned by Sherrif's Department unsigned / not posted.

Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia or syringes unless has a Doctor's order that it is a necessity, consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.     The defendant shall have no contact with Co-defendants K.H., J.I., C.R, or S.C.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant is not to have any contact with any drug users/dealers.
AMENDED 06/24/2022 - Signature bond amended to $500 Cash bond with same previous conditions.
AMENDED 08/09/2022 - Cash bond  amended to allow contact with S.C., all other conditions remain.

2:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Clint L. Block in court in custody from Clark County Jail.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant will seek an attorney
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
letter from Samantha Childs re: no contact

AMENDED 06/24/2022 - Signature bond amended to $500 Cash bond with same previous conditions.

1:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Clint L. Block appeared by video in custody from the Clark County Jail. Court orders the warrant canceled. Defendant acknowledged previously received of complaint. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. State requested bond to be amended to $500 Cash bond with previous conditions. Court orders $500 cash bond.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on August 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

09:55 AM Defendant Clint L. Block not in court. Prosecuting Atty Ellen Anderson appeared for State of Wisconsin.    Bench warrant was requested and authorized to be issued on the defendants failure to appear.
Initial appearance on March 8, 2022 at 09:50 am.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.     The defendant shall have no contact with Co-defendants K.H., J.I., C.R, or S.C.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant is not to have any contact with any drug users/dealers.

01:03 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Clint L. Block appeared, pro se from Clark County Jail by video.   Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 09:50 am.
